name: Transcriptr Project Rules
description: Comprehensive rules for the Transcriptr AI audio transcription application

rules.name: component-structure
rules: Use TypeScript interfaces for all props
Export components as named exports, not default exports
Use 'use client' directive for client-side components
Place hooks at the top of component functions
Implement proper error boundaries for complex components
Add proper ARIA labels for accessibility
Follow shadcn/ui patterns for UI components

rules.name: api-routes
rules.description: Next.js API route structure and patterns
rules: Use CORS headers for cross-origin requests
Add rate limiting for production endpoints
Use environment variables for sensitive data
Handle file uploads with proper validation

rules.name: typescript-strict
rules.description: TypeScript best practices and strict typing
rules: Avoid 'any' type - use proper typing or 'unknown'
Use interface for object shapes, type for unions/primitives
Implement proper return types for functions
Use enum or const assertions for constants
Add proper JSDoc comments for complex functions
Use utility types (Partial, Pick, Omit) when appropriate

rules.name: styling-tailwind
rules: Use Tailwind classes instead of custom CSS when possible
Use custom spacing variables for consistent design
Implement dark mode support with proper CSS variables
Use semantic color names from theme
Avoid magic numbers - use spacing scale
Use proper focus states for accessibility
Implement smooth transitions with Framer Motion
Use proper breakpoints (xs, touch, tablet, desktop)

rules.name: state-management
rules: Use useState for local component state
Use useEffect with proper dependency arrays
Use custom hooks for complex state logic
Avoid prop drilling - use context when appropriate
Use optimistic updates for better UX
Use proper TypeScript types for state

rules.name: file-handling
rules: Validate file types and sizes before upload
Use proper progress indicators for file operations
Implement proper error handling for file failures
Use Firebase Storage for file persistence
Handle large files with chunked uploads
Implement proper cleanup for temporary files

rules.name: performance
rules: Use React.lazy for code splitting large components
Use useCallback for stable function references
Optimize bundle size with dynamic imports
Use proper debouncing for user input
Implement virtual scrolling for large lists

rules.name: security
rules: Never expose API keys in client-side code
Use HTTPS for all API calls

rules.name: testing
rules: Write unit tests for utility functions
Mock external API calls in tests
Implement integration tests for API routes

rules.name: naming-conventions
rules: Use PascalCase for components and interfaces
Use camelCase for variables and functions
Use descriptive names for functions and variables
Use proper event handler naming (handle*, on*)
Use consistent naming patterns across the project

rules.name: error-handling
rules: Use try-catch blocks for async operations
Use proper error types and interfaces

rules.name: documentation
rules: Add JSDoc comments for complex functions
Add inline comments for complex logic
Add usage examples for complex components
Add proper README for new features
Use proper forwardRef for DOM elements
Use proper className merging with cn utility

standards: Use Bun as the package manager
Follow Conventional Commits for git messages
Use conventional commit format: feat(scope): description
Commit after every todo completion for atomic changes
Write clear, concise commit messages that describe changes
Use git checkout for branch switching
Use perl -C -i -pe for file text replacements
Run bun run lint before commits
Use chmod for file permission management

patterns: Keep components in feature-specific directories
Use index files for clean imports
Separate client and server code properly
Keep utilities in lib/ directory
Use proper TypeScript configuration
Maintain clean component exports
Use proper asset organization
Keep tests close to source files
Use proper configuration file organization
Maintain clean import/export structure
Use conventional commit format: feat(scope): description
Commit after every todo list or task ID completion for atomic changes
Write clear, concise commit messages that describe changes
Run bun run lint before committing changes
Use git checkout for branch switching operations
Use perl -C -i -pe for file text replacements
Use chmod for file permission management when needed
Use grep for searching within files
Use git add for staging changes
Avoid using head/tail commands - use dedicated tools instead

permissions: Bash(git add:*) - Stage files for commit
Bash(git commit:*) - Commit changes with proper messages
Bash(bun run lint:*) - Run linting before commits
